intro: Lastrea ascendens, commonly known as the ascending lastrea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Lastrea ascendens is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
